meanings.definition: Dugongs: large marine mammals with a rounded body and flippers, closely related to manatees.
meanings.sent1: Dugongs swim gracefully in the ocean, moving their flippers with ease.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study dugongs to learn more about marine life and conservation.
meanings.sent3: The dugongs had a family reunion under the sea, celebrating their unique features.
meanings.sent4: In the vast ocean, dugongs are like gentle giants gliding through the water.
meanings.sent5: Children love reading books about dugongs and their underwater adventures.

meanings.definition: Dugongs: the plural form of dugong, referring to more than one of these animals.
meanings.sent1: Look at those dugongs swimming together, a sight to behold in the sea.
meanings.sent2: Tourists often visit coastal areas to catch a glimpse of dugongs in their natural habitat.
meanings.sent3: The dugongs organized a party to celebrate their numbers, inviting all sea creatures.
meanings.sent4: In the group of dugongs, each member plays a vital role in their community.
meanings.sent5: The dugongs' population is carefully monitored to ensure their conservation and protection.
